data.title: Hatchbacks Explained: What Is A Hatchback Car?
data.meta_description: Wondering what a hatchback car is? We explain what a hatchback is & what you need to know about the different categories of hatchbacks.
data.text:
When the SUV is just too big, and the sedan isn’t your style, it’s time to consider the smaller, sportier, zippier, hatchback. Once solely the car of choice for the first-time owner and the budget-minded, the hatchback is now available in all iterations, from practical and fuel-saving, to car show ready, and dripping with high-performance tech and highly modern features.

Hatchback Cars Defined

What kind of cars are hatchbacks?

Hatchbacks come in all shapes and sizes, from small subcompacts to large crossover SUVs. Some hatchbacks even have all-wheel drive for added traction in inclement weather. So now, whether you’re looking for a versatile family car or a nimble city commuter, there’s definitely a hatchback out there that suit your needs.

The Differences Between Hatchbacks & Coupes

What is the difference between hatchbacks & coupes?

Hatchbacks and coupes are both popular choices for drivers, but there are some key differences between the two body styles.

Hatchbacks tend to be more versatile and practical, with a larger cargo area that is perfect for hauling around gear or groceries. They also usually have easier access to the rear seats, making them a good choice for families.

Coupes, on the other hand, are sleeker, with a sportier look. However, they often have less space inside, so they may not be as comfortable for long drives or for families with small children.

The Benefits of Owning a Hatchback Car

There are many benefits to owning a hatchback, and if you’re considering buying one, it’s important to be aware of them. Here are just a few of the advantages of owning a hatchback:

They’re great for city driving. Hatchbacks are nimble and easy to manoeuvre, making them ideal for getting around town.

They’re fuel-efficient. Hatchbacks tend to have excellent fuel economy, so you can save money on petrol.

They’re versatile. Hatchbacks offer plenty of space for passengers and cargo and can even be used for camping or other outdoor activities.

They’re affordable. Hatchbacks are typically more affordable than other types of vehicles, making them a great option for budget-minded buyers.

They have a stylish design. Hatchbacks are known for their sleek and stylish looks and can add a touch of luxury to your life.

Why You Should Buy a Hatchback Car

Hatchback cars are becoming increasingly popular, and for good reason. To sum up, here are some of the top reasons why you should consider buying a hatchback car:

Hatchback cars offer great value for money.

Hatchback cars are very versatile and can be used for a variety of purposes.

Hatchback cars are easy to drive and handle well.

Hatchback cars offer excellent fuel economy.

Hatchback cars are generally very reliable and low maintenance.

The Types of Subaru Hatchback Cars

Subaru’s offering in hatchback form is a pioneering crossover. Introducing, the XV. Let’s take a closer look.

Subaru XV

The Subaru XV is a compact crossover SUV with a hatchback design. The XV offers a sleek, sporty exterior and plenty of room for storage and passengers. This one also boasts impressive off-road capabilities thanks to Subaru’s Symmetrical All-Wheel Drive system, that’s powered by our famous BOXER 4-cylinder engine.

Along with some eye-catching styling upgrades like redesigned grille that accentuates its stance, and new 18-inch machine alloy wheels, the XV has an award-winning interior.

And then, of course, there’s the tech – Bluetooth, AUX, SATNAV and TomTom mapping, controllable via a beautiful touchscreen interface, along with our revolutionary standards like keyless entry, a multi-function steering wheel, and climate control.

As usual, though, the best way to truly experience the power, versatility, comfort and beauty of our hatchback offering, is to get behind the wheel of one and try it out for yourself. So, book a test drive now.
